intro: Cleome pruriens, commonly known as the痒草 or痒花, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 meters, featuring upright stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink, often with a slight purple tinge. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds, aiding in its dispersal. The plant is notable for its hairy texture, which can cause irritation upon contact with human skin.
